name: Hampton Inn & Suites Charleston / West Ashley

reviews.title: Great hotel/location/price
reviews.text: We are here now, and love the hotel. It has a great location 5 minutes from the airport and downtown. Manager's reception M-Th 5-7, beer, wine chips and salsa. Even complimentary bottle of water and pretzels at check in. Stayed in a King study, for a govt rate of 92/nt. Room wasn't huge but had a couch with pullout, free wireless in room and on pool patio. Lobby is very nice, continental breakfast had everything we needed:bagels, pastries cereal, coffee, juice, yogurt, and some rotated hot items, french toast sticks and sausage this AM. Complimentary USA Today paper every morning. Mall less than a mile away for shopping and movie options(small theater). Great king bed, very comfortable. Saw a king suite while it was being cleaned, two rooms very spacious. Food Lion grocery store around the corner, and CVS pharmacy. Ate at California Dreaming and Hyman's..loved both. Shopped the Tanger outlet mall, great kid clothing stores and deals. Also shopped King Street and Market area. Fort Sumpter tour this afternoon, chilly, bring a jacket. Plantation tours tomorrow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hampton Inn is right off I-526 behind a car dealer. There is a Japanese restaruant next door. The area is pretty quiet. It is only about 5 miles from Downtown. The price is right for the location.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location

reviews.text: This hotel is great because it is affordable, rooms are clean, and the hotel is well-maintained. Additionally, there is a manager's reception every night (beer, wine and finger food). I absolutely love that--hope they never do away with it. Next door, there is a great Japanese steak house.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay!!!

reviews.text: The only problem with this hotel is it is not located in the quaint part of Charleston and there are no views.
reviews.title: A nice hotel in a nice location
Very Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Other than that, this place is terrifice!! I highly recommend.

reviews.title: Beautiful and friendly place to stay
reviews.text: Beautiful place to stay. Clean, comfortable, the staff is very friendly, all smiles. Breakfast area is big, with lots of seating area and good, plentiful food. Everything was above standard. We stayed for Parents Weekend at the Citadel. Very convenient to the Citadel and a reasonable price. We would definitely stay here again.

I read the reviews posted by other guests at this hotel and expected that I would have a pleasant stay. My family and I paid $239 for a king suite with a whirpool tub and were sorely disappointed. The smell on the fourth floor was atrocious. The tub was unclean and the room smelled like mold. I bought my own cleansers and disinfectants to try and freshen up the place. It was horrible. I will never stay here again. We may have actually faired better if we had settled for a less expensive room.
reviews.title: Stale and Stinky

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at this hotel! We stayed here two nights in mid-June. We looked it up on tripadvisor, and took a chance. We are glad that we did! The hotel was VERY clean, spacious with a couch, and had good amenities, including free internet access. There were many TV stations available. There was an iron and an ironing board, and a hairdryer in our room. The A/C unit could actually be controlled and tamed (imagine that in a hotel :), and we slept well in the comfortable king sized bed. We enjoyed Charleston from this hotel, and depending on what side of Charleston we wanted to access, we took either the bypass, which is very convenient to the hotel, or the road directly in front of the hotel. This was cost effective, for the parking downtown was about $6 for an all-day slot, and we would have paid a higher cost for a hotel downtown, and would have paid parking in addition. So, it is definitely the way to go.
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.text: Near the hotel is a Food Lion supermarket, as well as places to eat, though we ate downtown at Hymans restaurant, where I had the best scallops in my lifetime.
reviews.title: Outside of downtown and cost effective
Great place!!
reviews.text: We will definitely stay there again. It is a well-kept secret, so don't let it out of the bag, lest it will be one of those hotels you can't ever seem to book. By the way, the breakfast is OK. Stay away from the biscuits, gravy, and eggs. The rest of it is great, including the bagels.

reviews.title: Charming, Convienent & Value - 3 in 1!!
reviews.text: I visited this Hampton Inn & Suites in West Ashley on a business trip and had to stay over on a weekend due to other travel cancellations. The staff was completely helpful in recommending what to do in the area for "fun" and from "a local's point of view." All employees that I encountered were very friendly, and the front desk even went the extra mile to remember me & greet me by name daily! The hotel is extremely clean (or should I say spotless...) they also offer not just your ordinary complimentary breakfast...but a wide assortment of items including biscuits, southern gravy and grits. And during the week, the managers host a free happy hour. I highly recommend this hotel to any Charleston visitors whether it is for business or personal travel.

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Charleston / West Ashley Hotel
description: The Hampton Inn & Suites® hotel in Charleston/West Ashley is near downtown historic Charleston, off of Highway 17, close to Citadel Mall, golf courses, and West Ashley historic plantations. Wake up to a free hot breakfast before venturing out in Charleston.
